title: Koko seeks NBI revamp over Korean’s kidnap-slay
text:
Koko seeks NBI revamp over Korean’s kidnap-slay By Marvin Sy (The Philippine Star)   
MANILA, Philippines - Senate President Aquilino Pimentel III called for the reorganization of the National Bureau of Investigation as he expressed disappointment over the alleged involvement of NBI agents in the kidnapping and killing of Korean businessman Jee Ick-joo. 
Pimentel said there is a need to reorganize the agency for it to regain the public trust. 
Pimentel, principal sponsor of the NBI Reorganization and Modernization Act, said the agency lost the opportunity to become an effective, modern and competent investigative body with the alleged involvement of its agents in illegal activities. 
Philippine National Police chief Ronald dela Rosa earlier said that rogue agents of the PNP and NBI were part of a syndicate that kidnapped and killed Jee. 
“This is a serious setback. The NBI has to do some housecleaning to regain public trust,” Pimentel said. 
Pimentel urged Gierran to take a firm stand in disciplining NBI personnel to avoid another embarrassment to the government.   
Meanwhile, Sen. Risa Hontiveros welcomed a decision giving the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency the task to implement the war against drugs, although she said it was nothing new because it is the PDEA’s mandate to go after illegal drugs. 
Unless the government’s anti-illegal drugs strategy is radically overhauled, Hontiveros said the campaign would “continue to be abusive and corrupt prone.” 
She said law enforcement agencies should start cleansing their ranks of scalawags.
